meanings.definition: In a manner that does not involve cell division.
meanings.sent1: The single-celled organism amitotically reproduced by splitting in half.
meanings.sent2: The cell amitotically divided into two identical daughter cells.
meanings.sent3: The amoeba decided to amitotically multiply by simply splitting in two.
meanings.sent4: The plant grew amitotically, spreading its roots far and wide without division.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria amitotically replicated, creating an exact copy of itself.

meanings.sent1: The organism amitotically reproduced by budding off a new individual.
meanings.sent2: The cell amitotically replicated by simply copying its genetic material.
meanings.sent3: The fish joked that it would amitotically grow a twin just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to amitotically expand its branches without any visible division.
meanings.sent5: The virus amitotically spread through the population, replicating rapidly.
